title: A New Bullish Technical Strategy on Morgan Stanley
text:
Morgan Stanley (MS) has been struggling since late April/early May but now the charts and indicators are finally suggesting that a move higher is possible. Let's drill down on our favorite charts and see if we can propose a new strategy.

In this daily bar chart of MS, below, we can see that prices have gapped above the bottoming 200-day moving average line. The slope of the shorter 50-day moving average line has turned positive.

The On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line has made a higher low and is very close to making a higher high which tells us that buyers of MS have been more aggressive.

The trend-following Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator gave a cover shorts buy signal and is about to cross the zero line for an outright buy signal.

All this is a big change from August when prices were breaking the lows of 2019.

In this weekly bar chart of MS, below, we can see that prices (when they are updated on this weekly chart) are above the bottoming 40-week moving average line.

The weekly OBV line has been improving irregularly since December and the MACD oscillator is likely to cross to the upside when Friday's close is calculated.

In this Point and Figure chart of MS, below, we can see a potential upside price target of $53.

Bottom line strategy: Risking below $42, traders could go long MS at current levels and if there is a shallow dip the next day or two. Our price targets are $52 and then $60.
description: The charts and indicators are finally suggesting that a move higher is possible....MS
authors: A New Bullish Technical Strategy On Morgan Stanley
Indicators Are Finally Suggesting That A Move Higher Is Possible.
